metadata.title: CVE-2021-29970 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.description: A malicious webpage could have triggered a use-after-free, memory corruption, and a potentially exploitable crash. *This bug could only be triggered when accessibility was enabled.*. This vulnerability affects Thunderbird < 78.12, Firefox ESR < 78.12, and Firefox < 90.

notes.note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in hirsute was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '90.0+build1-0ubuntu0.21.04.1').
mozjs78 package in hirsute is affected and may need fixing.
thunderbird package in hirsute was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:78.13.0+build1-0ubuntu0.21.04.2').
